intro: Leopoldia cupaniana, commonly known as the cupaniopsis, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, hard seeds. Leopoldia cupaniana is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its striking floral display.
